means: 临时替代者，临时应急措施

sentence.Network_en: The arrangement was only intended as a stopgap.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种安排不过是权宜之计而已。

sentence.Network_en: Candles are a stopgap when the electricity fails.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有电的时候腊烛可作代用品.

sentence.Network_en: Even if the bill were approved, it would be no more than a stopgap measure.
sentence.Network_cn: 即使议案获得批准，它也只不过是个临时措施。

stoper 向上式凿岩机stopgap 补缺者；权宜之计；补缺的stoppage of formation sand 地层砂的阻挡

list.abs: despite his recent efforts to revive reform , Mr Fukuda , a stopgap a return to the old , grey , back-room style .做为一个过渡性的首相，尽管福田最近努力重启改革，但他的当权意味着那种旧式密室政治的回归。

the factors causing accounting information distortion can be various , while the accountant appointment system is merely a stopgap measure to control accounting information distortion .影响会计信息失真的因素是多方面的,用会计委派制来治理会计信息失真只是一种治标的方法。
It ' s only a stopgap measure , not a long - term solution ., 这只是一个暂时的办法 , 并非长久之计.
stopgap measures ; a stopgap leader ., 暂时办法 ; 暂时的领导.
bristled with pent-up criticism of the auto industry , and questioned whether a stopgap loan would really cure what ails the companies .立法者承受来自汽车工业批评压力的同时，质疑临时贷款是否真的可以拯救那些公司。

entry.def: A stopgap is something that serves a purpose for a short time, but is replaced as soon as possible.

example.ex: Gone are the days when work was just a stopgap between leaving school and getting married...
example.tran: 工作曾经只是毕业和结婚之间的临时过渡，但这样的日子已经一去不复返了。

example.ex: Even if the bill were approved, it would be no more than a stopgap measure.
example.tran: 即使议案获得批准，它也只不过是个临时措施。

means.word_mean: 1. something contrived to meet an urgent need or emergency
